toc_entry.title: Hi-Yo, Silicon!
toc_entry.description: Texas’ glory, till now based on oil, may be based on silicon in years to come. The following four articles examine high tech in the state and where it is headed.

toc_entry.title: Birth Of A New Frontier
toc_entry.description: Hundreds of new computer companies have made Texas the likely successor to California's Silicon Valley, and it all started with two firms in Dallas.

toc_entry.title: Death Of A Computer
toc_entry.description: Four critical mistakes forced Texas Instruments to pull the plug on the home computer that it had once expected would dominate the market.

toc_entry.title: It’s A High-Tech Life
toc_entry.description: While most people are using their computers to balance their checkbooks and play games, these three Texans are pushing their machines and programs to the limit.

toc_entry.title: Look, Ma, My Computer Did It!
toc_entry.description: See the future on your computer: software on stocks, football, and astrology.

toc_entry.title: The Ponytail
toc_entry.description: Warm spring days call for giving in to new clothes and a neck-baring hairdo.

toc_entry.title: The Yellow Rose Of Texas
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: If it wasn’t for the song, no one would remember Emily Morgan, but she launched a nation by diverting Santa Anna at San Jacinto.

toc_entry.title: The Hub Cafe
toc_entry.description: It wasn’t the classiest place in Pharr to grow up, but it had tough truckers, sassy waitresses, and some of the best fry cooks in the Valley.

toc_entry.title: I Opened Tax Returns For the Irs
toc_entry.description: Behind the scenes at regional headquarters—a sometime part-timer tells all.

toc_entry.title: The Great World-Rim Being
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: A fresh interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Winter’s Travail
toc_entry.subtitle: Weather
toc_entry.description: When the Rio Grande Valley's balmy breezes turned frigid last winter, its aloe vera fields and stately palms turned from lush green to pitiful brown.

toc_entry.title: Light In the Hills
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: German landscape artist Hermann Lungkwitz saw romantic vistas in the Hill Country at a time when most Texans saw only hardscrabble farmland.

toc_entry.title: Alley Of Aspirations
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Houston’s well-heeled Alley Theatre is trying to pass itself off as a national theater. Across town, the Chocolate Bayou is just trying to hang on.

toc_entry.title: Programming Your Taxes
toc_entry.subtitle: Software
toc_entry.description: The first in a series of software reviews looks at tax-preparation packages.

toc_entry.title: Bait And Switch
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Against All Odds promises love, delivers yawns. Entre Nous repels rather than attracts. Footloose and Reckless aren’t. This Is Spinal Tap is painless.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Texas in silicon.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Watching the news, rating the crews, holding down the fort.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.description: A heated race for the Senate; a leisurely trip to Astrotown; a cool master of Dallas protocol; a steel-industry success story in Seguin.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Country pleasures.

toc_entry.title: Texas Monthly Puzzle
toc_entry.description: Toss of the coins.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Gary Hart’s rise hurts two Texas politicos; at last, a solution to the South Texas Nuclear Project mess; the all-new Braniff turns out to be the same old Braniff; a delicate question about doctors.
